    • Method Detail

      • getMaximumBufferSize

        public int getMaximumBufferSize()
        This method gets the maximum size used for buffers when parsing content. Please note that chars will use at least two bytes so e.g. StringBuffer s shall be allocated with a capacity at most maxBytes/2. Anyways the amount of memory allocated will typically be at least twice a much as maxBytes. E.g. a StringBuilder is created with a capacity of maxBytes/2 then StringBuilder.toString() may allocate another array of about that size. This is a legal behavior of the ContentParser. So if you want to limit your heap-size use a reasonable lower value for maxBytes. Please do NOT use values lower than 1024 (You do NOT want to parse Word-Documents with J2ME on your toaster, do you?).
        Specified by:
        getMaximumBufferSize in interface ContentParserOptions
        Returns:
        the maximum buffer size in bytes.
        See Also:
        ContentParserOptions.MAXIMUM_BUFFER_SIZE_DEFAULT

      • setMaximumBufferSize

        public void setMaximumBufferSize(int maximumBufferSize)
        Parameters:
        maximumBufferSize - is the maximumBufferSize to set

      • getEncoding

        public String getEncoding()
        This method gets the encoding used as fallback, if it can NOT be derived or detected automatically. Parsers for formats that make encoding explicit (e.g. XML) will completely ignore this parameter. For textual formats heuristics will be used to detect unicode (UTF*) if not disabled. By default UTF detection is enabled and the encoding is The default is EncodingUtil.SYSTEM_DEFAULT_ENCODING but replaced by EncodingUtil.ENCODING_ISO_8859_15 if UTF-based.
        Specified by:
        getEncoding in interface ContentParserOptions
        Returns:
        the fallback encoding.

      • setEncoding

        public void setEncoding(String encoding)
        Parameters:
        encoding - is the encoding to set

      • isDisableUtfDetection

        public boolean isDisableUtfDetection()
        This method determines if the automatic detection of UTF-encodings (unicode) shall be disabled. If this is disabled, textual files are read using the configured encoding. Otherwise it will be treaded as fallback if textual files do not seem to be unicode (UTF).
        Specified by:
        isDisableUtfDetection in interface ContentParserOptions
        Returns:
        true if unicode detection shall be disabled, false if enabled (default).

      • setDisableUtfDetection

        public void setDisableUtfDetection(boolean disableUnicodeDetection)
        Parameters:
        disableUnicodeDetection - is the disableUnicodeDetection to set
